text: <@U02C2ELN0TT> has joined the channel
“Designing for open source software” by Varun Pai <https://link.medium.com/fiJ55tvvhU> <@U9GR3G88Y> <@UFYGTT2VB>
Good final point, will take it along in the next iteration
Also, not sure if we already need it in the course view. I think checkpoint view is probably enough
But I think the design is a bit confusing. All these different kind of information in one line. Needs a bit more structure.
<@U9GR3G88Y> Iike the tags and names :wink:
First ideation for creator attributes <@U0D6EPESC> thoughts?
Cool! <@U9GR3G88Y> :star2:
<@U0D6EPESC> desktop and mobile version
Not yet, will elaborate on that on Monday
<@U9GR3G88Y>  I like the direction this is going. Do you also have a design for the mobile version?
Making in this way the distinction between this page and the About and FAQ page even bigger
I could even imagine that we might wanna add an extra visual indication to close the landing page, such as a simple close button in top right
New onboarding strategy <@U0D6EPESC>
Ah, then this was the "search-bug" you were talking about
<@U9GR3G88Y> known bug
(it initially shows and then disappears) (could be my internet?)
<@U0D6EPESC> If I search or go to Luke on the poatform, it shows a lot of different cards of others, is that a known bug ?

<@U0D6EPESC>, <@UBE37B8JX> told me that we can use the Open Collective logo. However, there is using, and adjusting. So this SVG is with a black overlay and without the "open collective" words in the logo, do you think we can use it like this?
Looks better <@U0D6EPESC>, can you send the links so I can edit FAQ and About text?
<@U9GR3G88Y> fixed faq: <http://offcourse-next.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/>
<@U0D6EPESC> Thought perhaps it was smaller than the standard headers, then it is probably visual illusion for me :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U9GR3G88Y> that's not the way that works. If i change the line spacing here, I change it for all the heading. Also the cards for instance....
Perhaps increase line spacing a little bit? <@U0D6EPESC>
^^ Wth button referring to card "Get Started With Offcourse"
<@U0D6EPESC> new version for overlay, quite a bit more subtle and trimmed down...
<@U9GR3G88Y> ^^ just in case... latest version link
<http://offcourse-next.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/>
Other headers give it immediately a lot more body
<@U0D6EPESC> what are your thoughts? In particular on FAQ double column.. Oh, and in current FAQ, font is quite a bit bigger, shall I give 20pt a try instead of 16?
<@U0D6EPESC>
<@U8AM0S37E> has left the channel
<@U9GR3G88Y>, I don't mean the error. I mean the normal stuff (Inkscape de Basics)

Yeah put the avatar + letters etc. on purpose above the text, because I feel like this error is in a sense a bit different from the other three, and could be generated a bit different, so visualization above text
yep... Content Load Error V5
Do you mean with breadcrumbs the avatar + extra visualization?
In your earlier sketches the breadcrumbs were below the task, now they are above (like in the first image above in this thread...)
<@U0D6EPESC> Not sure what you mean :')
The one just about my question :wink:
Not sure what you mean, can you give a screenshot example?
<@U9GR3G88Y>: the course breadcumb above the title in checkpoint view, is that how you want it? Or is that just an accident? (I like it btw.)
<@U0D6EPESC> trimmed it down a whole lot to make it fit better with the other 3, what are your thoughts?
<@U0D6EPESC> generic error screen to discuss today
<@U9GR3G88Y>
Unless you want to give this more elaborate version already a try, then feel free <@U0D6EPESC>. Kept it for now basic based on input of Donald
Then if that one is finished and we are further with the avatars (+VI), we can start to explore incorporation of avatars in the menu bar, etc.
<@U0D6EPESC> basic design of menu; I would say to make it like this for now, when we have further developed the avatars etc, we can extend it to a more advanced version
haha funky
now with animation...
<@U9GR3G88Y> checkout <http://offcourse-next.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/curator/luke/goal/discover%20design%20thinkinga>

Text center aligned looks a lot better, in this case I would overrule the standard left alignment since its the error is exceptional, in this way it visually also distinguishes from normal way of loading in content
<@U0D6EPESC> more visual exploration for content loading error
ps. for a not-found-course link use for instance this one: <http://offcourse-next.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/curator/luke/goal/discover%20design%20thinkinga>
<@U9GR3G88Y> if the next toplevel link does not work yet, take: <http://offcourse-next.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/>... Also, never forget to reset your cache... it can be quite sticky :wink:

<@U9GR3G88Y> for your meeting with <@U17C0L2VA> tomorrow, I've pushed the latest version to next. The checkpoint and course page as outlined above are built (don't forget to show mobile to <@U17C0L2VA>), and so is a first iteration of the 'course not found' page. Talk to you afterwards!
<@U9GR3G88Y>

text: in the case where the data is still missing, I would render the checkpoint without that complete section

<@U0D6EPESC> right aligned with more tags. I get your point, but I think this is also up to up to us to define. More tags are not neccesary better. But I get your point, you need to know how it will look like with multiple line tags; what I would do to solve the issue is perhaps to generate tags under the checkpoint data, in that case you got a full line for tags. I would still left align the string tho
